The protagonist, Sam, is a young woman who is part of the new ruling class. She's a member of a group of women who use their newfound power to exact revenge on the men who had previously held power over them. As Sam navigates this new world, she must confront the consequences of her actions and the moral implications of her new role.

Throughout the book, Alderman explores themes of power, oppression, and resistance, raising important questions about how societies function and how individuals respond to changes in their circumstances.

"The Power" is a gripping and timely novel that will keep you on the edge of your seat. I hope you enjoy it!
